5315.verse: فَذَرْنِى|So leave Me|101|137|17202$وَمَن|and whoever|105|176|1012$يُكَذِّبُ|denies|75|146|13290$بِهَـٰذَا|this|63|134|273$ٱلْحَدِيثِ‌ۖ|Statement,|95|131|10614$سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم|We will progressively lead them|227|251|7030$مِّنْ|from|50|98|53$حَيْثُ|where|68|116|371$لَا|not|42|90|30$يَعْلَمُونَ|they know.|94|118|115$

5316.verse: وَأُمْلِى|And I will give respite|162|189|7031$لَهُمْ‌ۚ|to them.|77|132|98$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|124|58$كَيْدِى|My plan|72|126|7032$مَتِينٌ|(is) firm.|76|103|7033$

5319.verse: فَٱصْبِرْ|So be patient|110|135|8535$لِحُكْمِ|for (the) decision|135|185|16237$رَبِّكَ|(of) your Lord,|117|167|1322$وَلَا|and (do) not|104|154|25$تَكُن|be|58|83|2943$كَصَاحِبِ|like (the) companion|155|183|17203$ٱلْحُوتِ|(of) the fish,|105|161|17204$إِذْ|when|55|111|1198$نَادَىٰ|he called out,|111|167|11069$وَهُوَ|while he|74|102|305$مَكْظُومٌ|(was) distressed.|135|135|17205$

5320.verse: لَّوْلَآ|If not|57|63|1090$أَن|that|48|60|655$تَدَٲرَكَهُۥ|overtook him|105|117|17206$نِعْمَةٌ|a Favor|70|82|12899$مِّن|from|50|62|53$رَّبِّهِۦ|his Lord,|76|88|392$لَنُبِذَ|surely he would have been thrown|248|254|17207$بِٱلْعَرَآءِ|onto (the) naked shore|174|252|14716$وَهُوَ|while he|74|230|305$مَذْمُومٌ|(was) blamed.|114|192|17208$

5321.verse: فَٱجْتَبَـٰهُ|But chose him,|118|143|17209$رَبُّهُۥ|his Lord,|76|127|1128$فَجَعَلَهُۥ|and made him|111|162|12814$مِنَ|of|50|101|156$ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ|the righteous.|117|142|1197$

5322.verse: وَإِن|And indeed,|98|105|213$يَكَادُ|would almost|106|120|170$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|103|20$كَفَرُواْ|disbelieve,|89|103|59$لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ|surely make you slip|153|167|17210$بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ|with their eyes|119|126|17211$لَمَّا|when|55|64|3471$سَمِعُواْ|they hear|84|101|5187$ٱلذِّكْرَ|the Message,|109|126|9717$وَيَقُولُونَ|and they say,|112|129|3019$إِنَّهُۥ|`Indeed, he|99|116|396$لَمَجْنُونٌ|(is) surely mad.`|131|140|9713$

5326.verse: وَمَآ|And what|83|118|46$أَدْرَٮٰكَ|will make you know|147|216|17213$مَا|what|53|122|262$ٱلْحَآقَّةُ|(is) the Inevitable Reality?|195|230|17212$

5328.verse: فَأَمَّا|So as for|80|107|265$ثَمُودُ|Thamud,|77|130|8716$فَأُهْلِكُواْ|they were destroyed|158|211|17215$بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ|by the overpowering (blast).|210|237|17216$

5330.verse: سَخَّرَهَا|Which He imposed|140|146|12099$عَلَيْهِمْ|upon them|90|102|22$سَبْعَ|(for) seven|94|106|303$لَيَالٍ|nights|60|72|11097$وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ|and eight|90|102|17219$أَيَّامٍ|days|53|65|1585$حُسُومًا|(in) succession,|125|131|17220$فَتَرَى|so you would see|135|148|5040$ٱلْقَوْمَ|the people|90|116|2316$فِيهَا|therein|66|92|253$صَرْعَىٰ|fallen|99|125|17221$كَأَنَّهُمْ|as if they were|120|146|944$أَعْجَازُ|trunks|84|97|16362$نَخْلٍ|(of) date-palms|124|366|16363$خَاوِيَةٍ|hollow.|78|320|17222$

5314.verse: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.

5315.verse: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.

5316.verse: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

5317.verse: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

5318.verse: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

5319.verse: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.

5320.verse: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.

5321.verse: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

5322.verse: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."

5323.verse: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.

5326.verse: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?

5327.verse: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.

5328.verse: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

5329.verse: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind

5330.verse: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

5331.verse: Then do you see of them any remains?
